security_audit.summary: All 40 static findings are false positives. The skill uses legitimate git commands (git status, git diff, git commit, git push) and GitHub CLI (gh pr create) for PR automation. Detected 'C2 keywords' and 'weak cryptographic algorithm' patterns are SHA256 hashes in the report metadata. External command references are standard bash patterns for git workflows documented in SKILL.md. This is a legitimate GitHub PR creation skill.

content.value_statement: This skill automates the GitHub pull request workflow including git status checks, staged commits with proper file paths, branch pushes, and PR creation via gh CLI. It ensures safe and consistent PR creation with Japanese language support.
actual_capabilities: Check git status and diff to review changes before committing
Validate project requirements from CLAUDE.md before committing
Create commits with explicit file paths (not git add .)
Push branches to remote and create pull requests with gh CLI
Generate PR descriptions following standard templates
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed for PR creation
Assumes git repository is already initialized and configured
Does not handle merge conflicts resolution automatically
Works with GitHub; other Git hosting platforms not supported

use_cases.title: Streamlined PR creation for developers
use_cases.description: Automate the complete PR workflow from change review to PR creation with proper validation steps.
use_cases.target_user: Developers who frequently create pull requests and want consistent workflow

use_cases.title: Safe commit practices enforcement
use_cases.description: Ensure commits use explicit file paths instead of git add . to prevent accidental staging.
use_cases.target_user: Teams requiring strict commit hygiene and code review processes

use_cases.title: Japanese language PR workflow
use_cases.description: Complete PR automation with Japanese communication for Japanese-speaking users.
use_cases.target_user: Japanese developers who prefer native language interaction

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR creation
prompt_templates.scenario: Simple request to create a pull request for current changes

prompt_templates.title: PR with description
prompt_templates.scenario: Request to create PR with detailed description of changes

prompt_templates.title: Feature branch PR
prompt_templates.scenario: Request to create PR for completed feature work

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow PR
prompt_templates.scenario: Complete workflow request with commit, push, and PR creation

output: ã‚³ãƒŸãƒƒãƒˆã‚’ä½œæˆã—ã¾ã—ãŸ: feat: Add new login functionality

best_practices: Always review git diff before committing to understand exact changes
Use explicit file paths in git add to avoid accidentally staging unrelated files
Check CLAUDE.md for project-specific requirements before committing
anti_patterns: Using git add . or git add -A which stages all changes indiscriminately
Skipping the CLAUDE.md validation step for project-specific requirements
Creating PRs without reviewing the diff first

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: This skill requires Git (for version control) and GitHub CLI (gh) installed for PR creation commands.

faq.question: Can this skill work with other Git hosting services?
faq.answer: No, this skill is designed specifically for GitHub using the gh CLI tool.

faq.question: Does this skill handle merge conflicts?
faq.answer: No, merge conflicts must be resolved manually before using this skill.

faq.question: What language does this skill use for communication?
faq.answer: This skill communicates in Japanese by default as designed for Japanese-speaking users.

faq.question: Can I customize the commit message format?
faq.answer: The skill follows existing commit message styles from git log and includes Claude Code attribution.

faq.question: Does this skill create branches?
faq.answer: No, this skill assumes you are already on a branch and pushes that branch to create the PR.
